title: Will Trump abandon Ukraine peace efforts?
snippets: The US president has threatened to 'move on' if he sees no progress from Russia and Ukraine.
titles: Will Trump abandon Ukraine peace efforts?
summary: The US president has issued a warning that he will consider taking alternative actions if there is no observable progress in the situation between Russia and Ukraine. This statement implies a potential shift in the US's approach or involvement if the current stalemate continues.

title: Putin calls an Easter ceasefire as Russia and Ukraine swap hundreds of POWs
snippets: The Russian president announced a temporary ceasefire, citing humanitarian reasons, as Russia and Ukraine swapped hundreds of captured soldiers.
titles: Putin calls an Easter ceasefire as Russia and Ukraine swap hundreds of POWs
constructiveness_reason: The story reports on a significant development in the Russia-Ukraine conflict, highlighting a solution-oriented approach with the ceasefire and prisoner swap. It provides insights into the dynamics of peace negotiations.
summary: The Russian president declared a temporary ceasefire for humanitarian reasons, coinciding with a prisoner exchange where Russia and Ukraine swapped hundreds of captured soldiers. This development marks a notable pause in hostilities between the two nations.

title: Five dead as huge waves hit Australia coast
snippets: Two other people are missing, as officials urge people to take caution as a surf warnings remain.
titles: Five dead as huge waves hit Australia coast
summary: Officials have issued surf warnings and are urging caution after two individuals were reported missing. The current status is that search efforts are ongoing to locate the missing persons amidst hazardous surf conditions.

title: Putin declares 'Easter truce', as Ukraine says he 'cannot be trusted'
snippets: The Russian president says he ordered his forces to "stop all military activity" until the end of Sunday.
titles: Putin declares 'Easter truce', as Ukraine says he 'cannot be trusted'
summary: The Russian president announced a directive for his forces to cease all military operations until the end of Sunday. This pause in action represents a temporary halt to ongoing activities, as stated by the president. The current status is a temporary cessation of military operations as ordered.

title: Is the US dollar at risk of a ‘confidence crisis’?
snippets: Fears about unpredictable policy are prompting investors to question their faith in the US dollar.
titles: Is the US dollar at risk of a ‘confidence crisis’?
summary: Concerns over unpredictable policy decisions have led investors to reconsider their confidence in the US dollar. This shift in sentiment is impacting the currency's stability and attractiveness as an investment.

His grand entrance was met with a smattering of applause from the 191 boys and girls divided up by age group, 6-16, all wearing their No. 11 ...
titles: As UConn awaits decision, Alex Karaban gives update on his coming or going during kids camp
summary: Alex Karaban, a two-time national champion with the UConn men's basketball team, led a basketball clinic at Newtown's NYA Sports and Fitness Complex. His arrival was warmly received by 191 children, ages 6-16, each wearing his No. 11 jersey. The event highlighted Karaban's growing proficiency in conducting basketball clinics and his positive reception in the community.

title: Putin declares 30-hour Easter ceasefire in Ukraine
snippets: Sirens sound in Kyiv as air defences open fire on incoming missiles minutes after announcement
titles: Putin declares 30-hour Easter ceasefire in Ukraine
summary: Sirens were activated in Kyiv, signaling an air raid as the city's air defenses engaged incoming missiles. This action occurred just minutes after an official announcement was made, indicating a prompt response to the aerial threat. The current status of the missile interception and the source of the attack were not specified in the provided information.

title: US Supreme Court temporarily halts deportations of migrants
snippets: Justices block Trump administration’s attempt to invoke long-standing but rarely-used law
titles: US Supreme Court temporarily halts deportations of migrants
summary: The Supreme Court has stopped the Trump administration from using a seldom-invoked law to carry out a specific policy. This decision effectively halts the administration's attempt to apply this old law in its current agenda, marking a significant judicial intervention in the executive branch's plans.

title: US and Iran agree to another round of talks to end nuclear stand-off
snippets: Adversaries will meet in Oman next week after ‘forward-looking’ negotiations in Rome
titles: US and Iran agree to another round of talks to end nuclear stand-off
summary: Adversaries are scheduled to meet in Oman next week following constructive negotiations in Rome. The discussions in Rome were described as 'forward-looking', indicating progress towards resolving their differences. This upcoming meeting in Oman represents a continuation of these efforts.

title: What Analysts Think of Google Parent Alphabet's Stock Ahead of Earnings
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Google parent Alphabet plans to report first-quarter results after the market closes Thursday.
  • A majority of analysts tracked by Visible Alpha have a "buy" or equivalent rating for the stock.
  • Citi analysts said they expect Google Search would be “among the last platforms to experience macro impacts and among the first to recover.”


Google parent Alphabet (GOOGL) is slated to report first-quarter results after the market closes Thursday, with analysts largely bullish on the tech giant's ability to weather economic uncertainty.

Citi analysts said recently they expect Google Search would be “among the last platforms to experience macro impacts and among the first to recover.” Citi also highlighted its potential for growth from the adoption of artificial intelligence tools like Google’s AI Mode in Search, as well as the latest iteration of the company’s Gemini large language model. 

Morgan Stanley also cited “AI-driven platform-level innovation” on Search and YouTube as a reason for “confidence in the durability of long term growth.” Citi and Morgan Stanley gave Alphabet price targets of $195 and $185, respectively. 

Of the 19 analysts covering Alphabet tracked by Visible Alpha, 14 have “buy” or equivalent ratings for the stock, with the rest issuing “hold” ratings. Their consensus price target near $195 would suggest roughly 29% upside from Thursday's closing price at about $151.

During the company's earnings call, Alphabet could face questions from analysts about a U.S. District Court ruling that Google has illegally maintained monopolies in the online advertising industry. Citi analysts said they “wouldn’t be surprised to see Google ultimately spin off its ad network,” as a result of the ruling, but that Google’s core businesses would likely not be as impacted.

Alphabet is expected to report fiscal first-quarter revenue of $89.22 billion, up 11% year-over-year, and net income of $24.71 billion, or $2.01 per share, up from $23.66 billion, or $1.89 per share, a year ago.

Shares of Alphabet have lost a fifth of their value so far in 2025 through Thursday's close. The U.S. stock market was closed Friday in observation of Good Friday.
titles: What Analysts Think of Google Parent Alphabet's Stock Ahead of Earnings
summary: Alphabet, Google's parent company, is set to report its first-quarter financial results soon, with analysts expecting positive outcomes despite economic uncertainties. A majority of analysts maintain a "buy" or equivalent rating on Alphabet's stock, citing the resilience of Google Search and potential growth from artificial intelligence innovations. Citi and Morgan Stanley have set price targets of $195 and $185, respectively, suggesting significant upside potential. Additionally, Alphabet may address a recent U.S. District Court ruling on its online advertising practices during its earnings c

title: Rory McIlroy's 9-Figure Net Worth—How He Made Millions On and Off the Course
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Champion pro golfer Rory McIlroy has made millions on and off the course.
  • McIlroy has a net worth of about $250 million, according to an estimate by Celebrity Net Worth.
  • In April 2025, McIlroy surpassed $100 million in career earnings on the PGA Tour, becoming the second golfer after Tiger Woods to do so.


Champion golfer Rory McIlroy has done what just five other professional golfers have been able to do—win a career Grand Slam.

McIlroy sank to his knees in tears following his victory over Justin Rose at the 2025 Masters Tournament in Augusta, Georgia, this month. The Masters title completed his career Grand Slam—in golf, this means McIlroy has won all four major championships at least once during his career: the U.S. Open, the Open Championship, the PGA Championship, and now The Masters. Gene Sarazen, Ben Hogan, Gary Player, Jack Nicklaus, and Tiger Woods are the only other golfers to win the modern career Grand Slam.

In his nearly two decades as a pro golfer, McIlroy has made a fortune on and off the course, with millions in career earnings, endorsements, and entrepreneurial ventures. McIlroy has a net worth of about $250 million, according to an estimate by Celebrity Net Worth.

Here's how McIlroy made his millions.

McIlroy's Career Earnings

Not only is McIlroy widely considered one of the best professional golfers, but he is also among the wealthiest. In April 2025, he surpassed $100 million in career earnings on the PGA Tour, becoming the second golfer after Tiger Woods to do so.

McIlroy was the second highest-paid golfer in the world in 2024, earning $38 million on the course between 2023 and 2024, according to Forbes.

With 29 PGA Tour wins in his nearly two decades as a pro golfer, McIlroy is in the top 20 for all-time wins in the PGA.

McIlroy's Partnerships and Businesses

When he's not golfing, McIlroy also makes millions from business ventures and partnerships. The champion golfer made an estimated $45 million off the course in 2024, according to Forbes.

Many of McIlroy's ventures off the course involve golf, too. He co-founded TMRW Sports, a sports media and entertainment company, with Tiger Woods and NBC Sports executive Mike McCarley. Among the company's ventures is TGL, a partly virtual golf league featuring top players from the PGA Tour. The league has two-hour weekly matches that air on ESPN and ESPN+.

McIlroy also founded an investment firm, Symphony Ventures, which has investments in companies including ticket marketplace TickPick, golf subscription GolfPass, virtual reality game Golf+, sports recovery company Hyperice, fitness tracker Whoop, and upscale mini golf chain, Puttery.

McIlroy's partnerships include major brands such as Nike, Optum, Workday, TaylorMade, and Omega.
titles: Rory McIlroy's 9-Figure Net Worth—How He Made Millions On and Off the Course
summary: Rory McIlroy won the 2025 Masters Tournament, completing a career Grand Slam, a feat achieved by only five other golfers. He sank to his knees in tears after defeating Justin Rose in Augusta, Georgia. McIlroy has a net worth of approximately $250 million and surpassed $100 million in PGA Tour career earnings in April 2025, becoming the second golfer after Tiger Woods to reach this milestone. He earned $38 million on the course between 2023 and 2024, making him the second highest-paid golfer globally according to Forbes. Off the course, McIlroy made an estimated $45 million in 2024 from busines

titles: New colour seen for the first time by tricking the eyes
summary: A newly developed device has allowed individuals to perceive a previously unseen shade of blue-green. Described as more intense than any color seen before, this advancement marks a significant achievement in color perception technology.

title: Scientists probe the mystery of Titan's missing deltas
snippets: New research finds that despite large rivers and seas of liquid methane, Saturn's moon Titan seems mostly devoid of river deltas, raising new questions about the surface dynamics on this alien world.
titles: Scientists probe the mystery of Titan's missing deltas
summary: Recent research indicates that Titan, Saturn's moon, despite possessing extensive rivers and seas of liquid methane, surprisingly lacks river deltas. This discovery prompts further investigation into the moon's unique surface processes, challenging previous understandings of its geology.
